column5: Headed out to Simcoe today with a good friend, Kyle McKee.  Kyle took up ice fishing last year and we have been out several times.  He is a pretty quick learner and has put some quality fish on the ice, already.  Today was a very slow day out there, we didnt mark a whole lot of fish, but the ones we did were big ones.  I had Kyle ripping a lipless crankbait up high and this fish hit around 930am.  I've added some other photos since my last report.  Most fish taken on X-Zone Swammers in pearl and Cisco.       VIDEO  http://youtu.be/gRRW8KYFgD8

Dang!  Beautiful stuff there    I was trying out your technique of cranking up 30 feet after jigging on bottom for a bit.  Couldn't believe it when I was ready to give up and drop back down again, two fish streaked off bottom to have a look.  They didn't hit, mind you, but, certainly opened my eyes a little to how these Simcoe lakers work.  When they charge up....do you move the bait at all?
Johnny, if you see those fish streaking off the bottom, keep reeling!   I've had lakers smash 20ft below the hole in 100ft of water.
Minimum 10" hole I'm guessing. Wow, what a tank.
Beauty    Congrats to Kyle
Take it away from them, the whities though, deadsticking is often best.  I could listen to Kyle's laugh in the video all day hahaha
Monster fish steve!! I am thinking of booking a bass charter with you this year, your youtube channel is quite impressive!
WOW...nice tankers !!! well done boys
MAybe they should keep the herring closed.  Monster lakers this year Steve. WTG boys.
Incredible fish, wow.
Good job putting your buddy on the fish of a lifetime.!!
So beautiful!
How's the ice?
Will try this weekend.
Now that is a sweet fish Congrats
Stevie...baby....you are killing me here man!  WICKED!!!!!
I couldnt get the link to the video to work?
Wow! Monster fish! Loved the video too
Wow! All of those Lakers are beauts!! Congrats on the PB!

Incredible fish  Definitely a fish of a lifetime. Great pics and vid   Yup! Eyes on the sonar, take a deep breath, crank the reel and wait for that spongy feeling at the end of the line  With that said, it's like a slap in the face when you see them chasing your lure from 120ft to 20ft only to reject it in the end.
nice fish boys!!222
Thanks for the replies!!
Nice Lakers, Congrats on the PB Tight Lines SBK
VERY nice fish.
Must be a really thrill Nice
